definition: to make invidious comparisons/to compete with/to emulate
to climb (by pulling oneself up)/to implicate/to claim connections of higher status
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)

sentences.english: We should not compare with the higher. Otherwise, we won't make both ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应与人攀比，否则就无法收支相抵。

sentences.english: Home improvement budget for the fiscal first step after the renovation.
sentences.chinese: 家装理财第五步不盲目攀比装修档次。

sentences.english: Do not undermine your worth by comparing yourself with others.
sentences.chinese: 不要跟人攀比而妄自菲薄。

sentences.english: In other words, this group shows strong "keeping up with the Joneses" behavior.
sentences.chinese: 换句话说，这组会员表现出强烈的攀比行为。

sentences.english: Like kids that have to one-up each other with the newest better toy.
sentences.chinese: 就像孩子们止不住互相攀比最新最好的玩具一样。

sentences.english: City slickers are more likely to keep up with the Joneses than the rural people.
sentences.chinese: 城市人的攀比心要比农村人强的多。

sentences.english: It has chosen to forgo keeping up with the “Joneses.”
God says it's stupid to compare yourself to others.
sentences.chinese: 上帝说和把你自己和别人攀比是愚蠢的。

sentences.english: Less stuff = less pressure to keep up with the Joneses.
sentences.chinese: 拥有越少=越少跟邻居攀比的压力。

sentences.english: The phenomenon of plagiarizing in college is the consequence of competitive psychology.
sentences.chinese: 大学的抄袭现象是心里攀比的一种结果。

sentences.english: Normally, this treatment mentality should be calm.
sentences.chinese: 按理，这攀比的心态应该平复了吧。
我们只是在跟自己攀比。

sentences.english: They were filled with all manner of unrighteousness, evil, covetousness, malice.
sentences.chinese: 他们态度恶劣，充满邪念，攀比，恶毒。

sentences.english: Whether one admits to it or not, to a certain degree, we all try to keep up with"the Jones".
sentences.chinese: 不论人们承认与否，一定程度上，我们都在相互攀比。
而攀比则强化了这种情绪。

sentences.english: "Compare yourself to other husbands, " she says.

definition: to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
to fight for fame, grab profit (idiom); scrambling for fame and wealth/only interested in personal gain
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
